hydrology101.title: Welcome to Hydrology 101!
hydrology101.overview: This introductory course will provide you with a foundational understanding of the hydrological cycle, water resources management, and the principles governing water movement and distribution on Earth.

topics.name: Introduction to Hydrology
topics.description: Basic concepts, the hydrologic cycle, and the importance of water.

topics.name: Precipitation
topics.description: Types, measurement, data analysis, and spatial variability.

topics.name: Evaporation and Transpiration
topics.description: Processes, influencing factors, estimation, and measurement.

topics.name: Infiltration and Soil Water
topics.description: Soil properties, infiltration process, soil moisture, and groundwater recharge.

topics.name: Groundwater Hydrology
topics.description: Aquifers, groundwater flow, well hydraulics, and groundwater management.

topics.name: Runoff Processes
topics.description: Factors affecting runoff, hydrographs, runoff estimation, and modeling.

topics.name: Streamflow
topics.description: Measurement, analysis, flow routing, and flood frequency analysis.

topics.name: Hydrologic Modeling
topics.description: Types of models, model calibration, validation, and application.

topics.name: Water Quality
topics.description: Introduction to water quality issues, pollutants, and monitoring.

topics.name: Water Resources Management
topics.description: Sustainable water use, planning, drought and flood management, and case studies.
